top_categories.workout_context: Unbound XL’s 350-mile distance demands power production deep into fatigue — the defining challenge of ultra-distance gravel.

Unbound XL’s pure limestone gravel — sharp edges regularly destroy tires, constant line-choice decisions demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Unbound XL isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.

Unbound XL’s pure limestone gravel — sharp edges regularly destroy tires, constant line-choice decisions and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Every session at Unbound XL intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
At 350 miles, Unbound XL rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Unbound XL — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Unbound XL when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Unbound XL rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.

Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Unbound XL — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on pure limestone gravel — sharp edges regularly destroy tires, constant line-choice decisions.
Unbound XL’s 14,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Unbound XL’s pure limestone gravel — sharp edges regularly destroy tires, constant line-choice decisions delivers on race day.

race_overlay.heat: May in Emporia, Kansas. Begin heat acclimatization 10–14 days before Unbound XL — 20–30min sauna sessions or midday rides in full kit. Pre-load sodium 48 hours out. Target 500–750ml/hr with electrolytes on race day.
race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 350 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 350 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Unbound XL. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Unbound XL demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride pure limestone gravel — sharp edges regularly destroy tires, constant line-choice decisions at race-day cadence weekly. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 350 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 350 miles of pure limestone gravel — sharp edges regularly destroy tires, constant line-choice decisions in Emporia, Kansas.
